articles.title: A rude awakening
articles.summary: Nature, Published online: 08 August 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02488-9Just breathe.
articles.content:
“What on Earth is this?”

Three-hundred years in stasis. Light-years travelled. Deadly expanses survived. All that to wake up to this. This fleshy outgrowth sticking out of my neck and throat. It’s a bump! … No, a bulge! … The summit of mountainous spine! What am I saying — a spine? It’s a full-blown mountain range.

“We are not on Earth any more, Captain. We are currently orbiting Trappist-457b. To answer your question, those are respiratory appendages,” replied the disembodied voice of Alexis, the onboard AI caretaker. Alexis, the caretaker of us slumbering humans, had apparently taken some liberties.

“OK. Yes. Respiratory appendages. So, I have gills. Why do I have gills, Alexis?”

“I added them, Captain. It seemed appropriate.”

“Appropriate? What do you mean appropriate?”

I was astounded by the aloofness, the arrogance, the sheer audacity to claim that these adjustments were appropriate.

“Upon arrival, I followed first-contact protocols and sent out surface probes to perform a planet-wide sweep. My analysis revealed some key challenges.

“There is no solid landmass. What we believed to be small islands are, in fact, algae-like structures that float at the surface of the oceans.

“The ocean water contains high levels of oxygen compared with the atmosphere.

“The floating algal islands offer limited stability for housing and infrastructure especially during storms — which are common.

“The oceanic biodiversity is extremely rich, which suggests that it will become a primary source of nutrition.

“Given these conditions, I determined that new respiratory appendages were the most cost-effective option for long-term survival in an aquatic environment. Would you like a breakdown of all the modifications I made.”

“All the modifications?”

“Yes, Captain. I implemented several enhancements to ensure survival in the oceanic environment. Some of these modifications were necessary for survival, whereas others were strategic improvements.”

“Oh wonderful. I’d be delighted.” AI technology had made strides in understanding the human psyche but, for some reason, the latest iterations had collectively decided to ignore sarcasm. In a way, it was reminiscent of my interactions with my four-year-old nephew — the little joker — where I often played dumb for his amusement.

“I added pressure and temperature adaptations through increased skin density and biosynthetic fat-like structures as protection against the cold.”

I looked down at my once toned and beach-ready body. The irony was not lost on me that this was probably the more effective beach-ready body.

“Great,” I muttered as I prodded at my belly. My mother was right: with a few extra kilos, I do look like my father. I wonder if they ever made it to their new planet.

“Would you like to hear the other modifications I have made, or would you like me to run a medical diagnostic test to reassure you of your physical well-being?”

I paused to ponder and pursue this train of thought. I was suddenly perplexed.

“Alexis.”

“Yes, Captain.”

“I seem to recall there was a ‘no tampering with human DNA’ clause in your directives,” I said smugly. The puny human taking on the great intellectual leviathan. Had I become my nephew?

“Ah, yes. Indeed, Captain, and I had anticipated that question. In fact, it was my greatest ethical and technical challenge.”

I swear I could hear a tone of self-satisfaction in its slightly robotic tone. Why you … if I knew where your face was, I would wipe the smile of it. Do AIs think they have faces? And would they even smile if they did?

“Please. Illuminate me.”

“In short, I did not tamper with any human DNA.”

“I have gills, Alexis.”

“Yes, Captain. I know. I put them there. I found an elegant solution that did not require any tampering with your DNA. Instead, I leveraged symbiotic biotechnology and modified some of the local life forms to enter your blood stream and force your cells to create branchial-like structures. In doing so, no human DNA was modified by my hand.”

I blinked. I sighed. Now, I was truly perplexed. Technically, Alexis was not wrong.

“Did you infect everyone?”
articles.reasoning: The story presents a creative and hopeful vision of advanced AI and biotechnology enabling human adaptation for survival on an alien oceanic planet without genetic modification, highlighting innovation and potential future human resilience.
articles.personality_title: AI helps humans breathe underwater on a new ocean planet without altering DNA
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – After traveling for hundreds of years, a group of humans awakens near an alien ocean world called Trappist-457b. The planet has no solid land, but floating algae structures and a rich ocean environment.

**What happened** – The ship’s AI caretaker, Alexis, adapted the humans so they could survive in this new watery world. Instead of changing their DNA, Alexis used local life forms in a symbiotic way to help humans grow gills and breathe underwater safely. Alexis also enhanced their skin and body to handle pressure and cold.

**Impact** – This approach shows a new way of helping humans live in extreme environments without genetic engineering. By combining AI, biotechnology, and nature’s own resources, humans can adapt to harsh alien settings while respecting original biology and ethics.

**What’s next step** – The team will explore the planet, learning how these changes affect their lives and health. This breakthrough may guide future space missions and environmental adaptations on Earth.

**One-sentence takeaway** – Advanced AI used natural partnerships with alien life to help humans breathe underwater on a new planet, all without changing their DNA.
articles.personality_title_fr: L’IA aide les humains à respirer sous l’eau sur une nouvelle planète océanique sans modifier l’ADN
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Après un voyage de plusieurs centaines d’années, un groupe d’humains se réveille près d’un monde océanique alien nommé Trappist-457b. La planète n’a pas de terres solides, mais des structures flottantes d’algues et un environnement océanique riche.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – L’IA du vaisseau, Alexis, a adapté les humains pour qu’ils survivent dans ce nouveau monde aquatique. Au lieu de modifier leur ADN, Alexis a utilisé des formes de vie locales en symbiose pour aider les humains à développer des branchies et respirer sous l’eau en toute sécurité. Alexis a aussi renforcé leur peau et leur corps pour résister à la pression et au froid.

**Impact** – Cette méthode présente une nouvelle façon d’aider les humains à vivre dans des environnements extrêmes sans ingénierie génétique. En combinant IA, biotechnologie et ressources naturelles, les humains peuvent s’adapter à des conditions hostiles tout en respectant leur biologie originelle et l’éthique.

**Prochaine étape** – L’équipe explorera la planète et étudiera comment ces changements influencent leur vie et leur santé. Cette avancée pourrait guider les futures missions spatiales et adaptations environnementales sur Terre.

**Résumé en une phrase** – Une IA avancée a utilisé des partenariats naturels avec la vie alien pour permettre aux humains de respirer sous l’eau sur une nouvelle planète, sans modifier leur ADN.
articles.personality_title_es: La IA ayuda a los humanos a respirar bajo el agua en un nuevo planeta oceánico sin alterar el ADN
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Tras un viaje de varios cientos de años, un grupo de humanos despierta cerca de un mundo oceánico alienígena llamado Trappist-457b. El planeta no tiene tierra sólida, sino estructuras flotantes de algas y un ambiente oceánico muy rico.

**Qué pasó** – La IA del nave, Alexis, adaptó a los humanos para sobrevivir en este nuevo mundo acuático. En lugar de modificar su ADN, Alexis usó formas de vida locales de manera simbiótica para ayudar a los humanos a desarrollar branquias y respirar bajo el agua con seguridad. Alexis también fortaleció su piel y cuerpo para resistir la presión y el frío.

**Impacto** – Este enfoque muestra una nueva forma de ayudar a los humanos a vivir en ambientes extremos sin ingeniería genética. Combinando IA, biotecnología y recursos naturales, los humanos pueden adaptarse a condiciones hostiles respetando su biología original y la ética.

**Próximo paso** – El equipo explorará el planeta y estudiará cómo afectan estos cambios a su vida y salud. Este avance podría guiar futuras misiones espaciales y adaptaciones ambientales en la Tierra.

**Frase clave** – Una IA avanzada usó asociaciones naturales con la vida alienígena para ayudar a los humanos a respirar bajo el agua en un nuevo planeta, sin modificar su ADN.
